title: 108_hr3639
content: The American Workers Assistance Act, also known as the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002, is being extended for six months. Section 208 is amended to specify the applicability of the program. The agreement under the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act applies to weeks of unemployment starting after the agreement is entered into and ending before July 1, 2004. For individuals receiving benefits before July 1, 2004, compensation will continue until December 31, 2004. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 (Public Law 107-147; 26 U.S.C. 3304 note) will have an effect as if included in the enactment. SEC. 3. ENTITLEMENT TO ADDITIONAL WEEKS OF TEMPORARY EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION. The amount established in an account under subsection (a) shall be equal to 26 times the individual's weekly benefit amount for the benefit year. Additionally, the amendments made by this section shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002, but shall apply only with respect to weeks of unemployment. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to apply to weeks of unemployment after the enactment of this Act. Special rules apply to individuals with existing temporary extended unemployment compensation accounts. Amounts deposited before the enactment date are treated differently. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to apply to weeks of unemployment after the enactment of this Act. Special rules apply to individuals with existing temporary extended unemployment compensation accounts, disregarding previous determinations and applying new criteria. According to section 203(b) of the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002, individuals must exhaust their benefits, with special considerations for accounts augmented and exhausted before the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. EXTENDED BENEFIT PERIODS. Section 207 is amended to apply the revised rate of insured unemployment. The term 'rate of insured unemployment' is redefined for weeks of unemployment after the enactment date, considering individuals exhausting their right to regular compensation in the most recent 3 months before the rate determination period. The extended benefit period trigger is amended to include an additional provision for weeks of unemployment after the enactment date. The extended benefit period trigger is amended to include a State 'on' indicator based on specific unemployment rate criteria. The extended benefit period trigger is amended to include a State 'on' indicator if specific unemployment rate criteria are not met, regardless of any agreements. The extended benefit period trigger is amended to include a State 'on' indicator if specific unemployment rate criteria are not met, regardless of any agreements. Determinations of total unemployment rates in any State will be made by the Secretary. Section 203(c)(1) is amended to include paragraph (3) after paragraph (2).
